title: Data Analyst
description: 8 April 2021 We are in search for a Data Analyst who can leverage his/her analytics skills to support automation and data analytics projects. Mandatory Skill(s) Degree holder majoring in Finance, Analytics, Computer Science or equivalent; Experience and hands on skills in Python, SQL, Tableau; Proficient in data analysis, data visualization and working with large scale datasets; Experience in data modelling , data mining as well as machine learning; Proficient in Microsoft and VBA; Strong communication skills with an analytical mindset. Desirable Skill(s) Experience working in Unix/Linux environment; Python certified; Tableau or Qlik certified. Responsibilities Collaborate with different stakeholders to understand data needs, gather requirements and implement data solutions to deliver business goals; Responsible for raw data analysis and data profiling for data integration; Build and maintain data queries as well as data pipelines using SQL and Python; Provide technical solutions... design scalable data models and suggest visualizations to meet the business objectives; Take part in designing and executing user acceptance testing; Build and improve regulatory reporting dashboards and conduct monthly reporting; Ensure documentation and traceability of requirements and, process flow diagrams, and other project documents

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will perform a variety of duties around data lifecycle management and data value chain related to sourcing, analysing, and presenting data. As part of this role, you will extract, normalise, and transform data for derivation of business and performance insights through data science techniques and dashboard visualization The role is required to facilitate the discovery of integration points in entities, attributes, relationships, and business rules by engaging various business units and support teams within SJ and to operationalize data analytics initiatives and generate data insights from numerous data sources in support of key stakeholders.
• Translate pain-points into problem statements, develop analytics solutions, and present results and learnings to both technical and non-technical audiences in an engaging manner.
• Build and maintain data queries as well as data pipelines through tools such as SQL, NoSQL
• Build sophisticated dashboards and... automated reports for core business metrics and performance trends using visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik or Power BI
• Contribute to the data architecture engineering decisions to support analytics.
• Help to identify the right data sources and data features that will be used to develop data science algorithms.
• Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide statistics or features that will drive business objectives and derive business insights
• Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide regular status reporting and support them to refine issues/problem statements and propose/evaluate relevant analytics solutions
• Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical skills, business savviness and data science competencies to deliver work in a waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies
• Ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication to team members and clients

Requirements
• Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.
• Hands on experience with AWS, Azure, Cloudera, (or other Cloud & Big Data services),Data pipeline and/or database development experience
• Knowledge of statistical modelling, predictive analytics or machine learning
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in Data Analytics with competency in three or more of the following areas:
• Data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI )
• SQL knowledge & Data modelling tools (e.g Erwin, Denodo)
• Programming or scripting language (e.g. Python, R, Java)
• Analytical software (e.g. SPSS, SAS)
• Distributed architectures (e.g. HDFS, Hive, Spark)
• Certification in leading data analytics platforms such as Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI, Informatica, Talend, SAS, etc.

Qualification

Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Burpple is seeking a Data Scientist. We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The job is to be the"data eyes and ears" guiding the product team.

The Role Objective
• Defining new opportunities for product impact Influencing product and sales to solve the most impactful market problems.
• Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our products.
• Work as a key member of the product team to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.
• Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions and product launches.
• Set KPIs and goals, design and evaluate experiments, monitor key product metrics, understand root causes of changes in metrics.
• Exploratory analysis to discover new opportunities: understanding ecosystems, user behaviours, and... long-term trends Identifying levers to help move key metrics.

Responsibilities
• Product Strategy : Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics along with Product Managers and Product Designers.
• Data Visualization: Democratize data by building customized dashboards & reports for relevant stakeholders.
• Analysis: Offer deep dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products, in order to determine product features and UX optimization strategies.
• Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
• Provide data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
• Responsible for developing and executing tools to monitor and report on data quality
• Responsible for establishing appreciation and adherence to the principles of data quality management, including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
• Build Machine Learning models to predict behaviour of users

Required Qualifications
• Overall, 5 years of experience with at least 1 year of experience specifically in Product Analytics, preferably in e-commerce
• You've master’s degree in Business Analytics, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (Python,R & ETL frameworks)
• A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
• Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics (Preferably IQ certified) or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude
• Should understand Machine Learning Algorithms
• Excellent attention to detail can-do attitude with a relentless focus to get things done. Data needs to be precise. Conclusions drawn from data analysis will drive critical client decisions.
• Demonstrated analytical skills. Ability to work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. Ability to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions

title: Market Data Business Analyst
description:
Market Data Business Analyst

MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
YOUR IMPACT

The Market Data Business Analyst team at Goldman Sachs are responsible for coordinating with internal business teams on the selection of products and ongoing management of the Firm's market data spend with third party vendors. The team provide guidance to internal users on data services appropriate for specific roles, coordinate expense management initiatives and provide data analytics to enable users to manage costs effectively.

The role provides the opportunity to directly contribute to managing the firms operating costs by building data analytics and automated workflow that help end-users to manage their market data subscriptions effectively. You will be responsible for developing data collection, modelling and visualization analytics that correlate usage with user inventories. The role will provide the opportunity to partner with divisional management and business unit leadership teams to implement expense management... initiatives.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
HOW WILL YOU FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

• You will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication
• Driving strategic initiatives and deliver key programs of work across Market Data and the broader division
• Your detailed knowledge of market data vendor products and an understanding of the Goldman Sachs business functions will enable you to formulate strategies to reduce operating expenses
• Building data analytics using popular storage and visualization technologies to empower market data users to manage their costs
• Interface with divisional leadership and front office users to implement expense management initiatives
• Continually evaluate the vendor landscape to identify new offerings that may increase value and efficiency for our employees who require access to market data BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

• 2 years minimum experience in Market Data
• Python and SQL programming skills
• Experience of publishing and modeling data with distributed storage platforms such as Hadoop
• Experience with using visualization software (Tableau, Qlikview or equivalent)
• Japanese language PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• FISD's Financial Information Associate certification
• Proficient use of tier 1 market data vendor desktop software
• General understanding of the capital markets
• Experience of the MDSL MDM inventory system

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers .

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https:// www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Analyst - Analytics & Cognitive - SG
via: via Jobs At Deloitte Southeast Asia - Deloitte
description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talent like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy, Growth & Innovation portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets. This role sits within the Analytics & Cognitive team of Deloitte... Southeast Asia, which encompasses data, analytics and cognitive automation.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

If you are someone with:
• Strong academic performance in your undergraduate degree from any academic majors preferably Data Analytics, Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or Mathematics
• Team player with effective interpersonal and communication skills, demonstrated leadership and teamwork within or outside a work setting
• Exceptional problem-solving ability., logical reasoning, creative thinking, comfort with numbers, and the ability to untangle complex issues
• Understanding of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
• Understanding of SDLC Waterfall and Agile Development Methodologies
• Strong analytical skills, excellent oral and written communication skills in English
• Drive, tenacity, entrepreneurship, client focused and results oriented
• Proven demonstration of sound business acumen & teamwork, confidence in public speaking and presentation preparation is appreciated
• Strong passion for consulting, ability to adapt and cope in a fast pace and a sense of humor!

For our Intelligent Automation practice:
• Certification with Automation Anywhere, BluePrism, UiPath or WorkFusion will be advantageous.
• Mastery of one programming language: C, Java, .Net, Python

For our Data Modernisation & Advanced Analytics practice:
• A certification with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Microsoft Azure is highly recommended
• Experience with one or more non-relational data stores such as Pivotal, Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Oracle BDA would be an advantage
• Experience with one or more relational data stores using SQL, Oracle DB, Microsoft SQL Server, IBM Netezza, Teradata, MySQL or LibreSQL would be an advantage
• An interest in data ingestion and transformation pipelines using Big Data technologies, including one or more of the following: Spark, Hive, Pig, Kafka, MapReduce, HBase, Sqoop, Flume or Storm
• General knowledge of Linux/Unix based operating systems and Shell scripting would be an advantage
• A demonstrated interest for all the latest technologies, libraries & languages. To name a few: ML, NLP, AI, Python, IoT, Blockchain, etc.

Next Steps

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now. You can submit your application here:

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

title: Control and Metrics External Data Analyst (Associate Director)
description:
At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group's global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today!

Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities.
Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Control and Metrics External Data Analyst in our Data Management team! !
To pursue its ambition to become a data-driven company, BOS is looking to empower each users of the organization with self-service reporting capabilities. As part of this data transformation, BOS has set-up an Hub & Spoke Organization: Data Hub is a central team managing the... tools, governance, methodology and knowledge sharing among the various business Data Spoke from all departments (Finance, Risk, Compliance, HR, Marketing).
General Description
The Control and Metrics External Data Analyst will support the Chief Data and Innovation Officer in delivering the Bank of Singapore Data Strategy. The strategy includes enterprise wide implementation of the Hub & Spoke data organization (including External Data), Data Quality framework, the data science blueprint and will combine domain, organizational and industry skills with analytical tools and communication tactics, to help the Bank achieve low total cost of ownership (TCO) and rapid return on investment (ROI) for its Data and Innovation initiatives.
The External Data Unit is newly established in BOS Data Hub to:
• Centralize the commercial negotiation with External Data Vendors
• Collaborate with IT on overall target data infrastructure
• Analyse and rationalize Bank's External Data consumption
• Govern Bank's External Data Inventory / Dictionary
• Coordinate with Group for synergies and implement a cohesive / efficient market data strategy.
As the Control and Metrics External Data Analyst, you are part of the Data Hub team on the mission to accelerate the adoption of data analytics tools and best practice across the organization through the following core activities:
Primary Responsibilities:
A) Managing External Data vendors
• Relationship Management of strategic vendors including Exchanges and Brokers
• Manage and coordinate vendor activities such as notifications on changes, trials, demos, training and recontract discussions
• Evaluate potential new solutions / products and implement to maximise External Data value
B) Managing External Data requests and solutions
• Provide advice and support for external data requests
• Review of Business Unit External Data Inventory / Dictionary
• Endorse the external data requests across platforms, applications and desktops
• Regular interaction with Business Units to review external data costs optimization initiatives
• Collaborating with Group including Procurement, Treasury, Technology & functions to maximise market data usage
• Consolidate existing external data access across divisions to establish the current data usage requirements
• Distribute analysis and reporting usage to establish key requirements and metrics to support and assist contract negotiations
• Regular analysis on cost and usage
• External Data Billing and Cost Reallocation Management

Qualifications
Requirements:
• Market Data knowledge within large financial institution or bank; with 3-5 years relevant experience
• Banking industry data infrastructure knowledge
• Vendor knowledge such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, Morningstar, Allfunds etc
• Knowledge on requirements related to FTP/ APIs/ Microservice (data integration / distribution capabilities) will be a plus
• Ability to work independently and execute with a sense of urgency
• Attention to details and able to work under pressure
• Proactive, self-motivated and proven ability to use own initiative and judgment to work with internal stakeholders in a positive manner and help deliver solutions that benefit the business
• Proven ability to operate effectively at all levels in a collaborative manner
• Proficient in Excel, and Powerpoint
• Knowledge in coding language will be a plus
Accounting & Finance

title: Data Engineer (Data Analytics) - Contract
description:
Job Purpose:
We are looking for an experienced data engineer to join our rapidly growing data team. You will be joining the team at an early stage of data warehouse development and your contributions will influence key design choices for the data warehouse. The role will require you to work with data owners to build data ingestion pipelines, construct data models for the warehouse and to maintain the operational stability of processes created. You will also work with data end users to expose data as required by decision support tools. Overall, you will strive for excellence by aligning the data systems created with business goals presented.

Responsibilities:
The duties and responsibilities are listed below. The list is not comprehensive and related duties and responsibilities may be assigned from time to time.
• Understand the data landscape to formulate and complete end-to-end data strategy that includes data gathering, data processing, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and... presentations to facilitate decision-making and forward planning.
• Identify opportunities for data acquisition, work with system owners to automate data connection.
• Analyse and organize raw data, combine raw information from different sources, build data systems and data pipelines, perform extract transform and load (ETL) to prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling.
• Build algorithms and prototypes, explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability; Develop analytical tools and programs
• Collaborate with data scientists and architects on several projects

Requirement:
• Tertiary qualification with experience in data engineering or in a similar role
• Experience in enterprise scale data migration and/or integration
• Hands-on experience working with Azure Data Factory & SQL Server Integration Service with SAP, IBM or Microsoft SaaS and/or PaaS data sources
• Data engineering certification is a plus
• Experience in building a data system front-end is a plus
Technical skills include:
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, clean, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Ability to understand and explain complex data and effective working as a liaison between technical and non-technical groups
• Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
• Hands-on experience with SQL database design
• Advanced knowledge of SQL is required and familiarity with other languages (C#/.NET, Python, Java, JavaScript) is a plus
• Great numerical and analytical skills, experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qliksense, etc. would be an advantage
Generic skills include:
• Detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills and experience
• Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
• Team player
• Good time-management skill
• Great interpersonal and communication skills

title: Data Analyst - Singapore
description:
We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with stakeholders from Marketing, Sales, People Science, Product, Customer Success and Engineering to understand their needs/pain points
• Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
• Design solutions to be used for strengthening marketing and/or product for prospects and customers, including but not limited to developing and maintaining visualisations, reports, and metrics using data from multiple systems (G Suite, Hubspot, EngageRocket, etc.) that communicate... information effectively using Tableau / Metabase or similar tools
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Filter and “clean” data by reviewing raw and processed data tables to locate and correct code problems
• Work with management to prioritise business and information needs
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Requirements
• At least 2-3 years working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, python, R, etc)
• Analyse Web Application data and suggest actionable insights for improvements
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Strong communications skills: adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
• BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

title: APAC Senior Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics)
description:
Job Description

Kimberly-Clark makes the essentials for a better life – with brands that matter every day, everywhere people go. Throughout our 142 years, we have challenged conventional wisdom to innovate products for the evolving needs of consumers worldwide. We’ve created new categories with top brands like Kleenex®. And we’ve redefined categories with brands like Huggies® and U by Kotex®.

While growing our $20+ billion global business, we also help build your career – through collaborative teams that push boundaries, through engaging experiences, and endless opportunities to work with some of the world’s most recognized brands. Our 42,000 employees are changing the world for the better, too, generously giving back to communities and causes around the globe. If innovative thinking and a passion to win inspire you, come Unleash Your Power at Kimberly-Clark.

Role Summary

As the APAC Senior Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics ), you will be part of the APAC Regional Digital team at... Kimberly Clark. You will work closely with the Digital & Brand teams across APAC to uncover meaningful and actionable insights to inform decision making. In this role, you will build advanced models to solve business problems and deliver data-driven recommendations to identify key marketing levers and optimize marketing spend.

Key Responsibilities

Some of your key responsibilities will include:
• Build, evaluate, publish and refresh marketing mix models (MMM) across paid, owned, earned and shared channels to analyze ROI from marketing spend, optimize spend allocation by channels and identify key sales drivers.
• Partner with cross-functional business stakeholders and agency partners to leverage the power of MMM by identifying high impact opportunities for its application and ensuring value-adoption.
• Manage data requirements for multiple projects including sourcing data across the organization, model refreshes and data integrations that support attribution models.
• Collaborate with the Digital, Brand/Marketing and technology teams to understand business and marketing objectives to develop analytics approaches
• Drive CRM analytics by working closely with CRM team (marketing & IT) to identify and analyze key trends in customer acquisition and maximize consumer engagement and retention.
• Lead initiatives to define and increase customer lifetime value within and across KC’s brands.

WHY YOU?

We seek Original Thinkers to join us. We welcome original perspectives and value different life experiences that can lead to groundbreaking innovation, creative problem solving and agile response to change. With Kimberly-Clark, you will have the freedom to express yourself, develop your capabilities and grow your career.

Key to your success in this role will be:
• Relevant Bachelors’ Degree
• Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in building regression models, customer segmentation & data-driven marketing.
• Experience in marketing mixed modelling studies
• Experience with reporting and analysis using digital marketing platforms such as Facebook Ads, Google Marketing Platform and other digital marketing platforms.
• Have a good understanding of CRM marketing (Salesforce Marketing Cloud)
• Working knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI preferred. Experience with marketing intelligence tools like Datorama highly desirable.
• Strong statistical knowledge
• Proficient in R/Python, SQL and Google BigQuery is a big plus.
• Experience working with cross-functional and cross-geographical teams will be ideal.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex data concepts to business users.
• Self-starter and willing to take the initiative in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

title: #NEXTDIGITAL2020 - Consultant / Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence (Data Visualisation)
description:
About NCS

NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions.

What is the opportunity?

NCS is looking for a data visionary to help businesses identify key performance metrics and dimensions for data analysis. You will create crystal clear, compelling visualisations of data in clients’ business intelligence or data visualisation tools – using dashboards and reports to tease out and share insights from data.

To do this, you need to have top-notch communications skills – with clients you will interact closely with, and... teams you need to collaborate with – to supply your data canvas with the information they need to convey just the right amount of information, to the right audience, and help them make better data-driven decisions.

What will you do?
• Dive into company data to identify sources and features that will drive business objectives.
• Build powerful, stand-out dashboards and automate reports for core business metrics and performance trends.
• Grasp users’ needs and challenges, and translate them into business and technology solutions
• Tap on your inner artist – use creative data visualisation techniques and tools to give users the best experience possible
• Prototype new ideas as part of a digital product team – from research to release
• Migrate and operationalise home-grown reports to enterprise grade business workflows powered by data insights - work with data engineering team throughout the data lifecycle from source to analysis to modelling.
• Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide regular status reporting and support them to refine issues/problem statements and propose/evaluate relevant analytics solutions
• Bring your experience and ideas to effective and innovative engineering, design and strategy
• Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and data science competencies that deliver work in waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies
• The range of accountability, responsibility and autonomy will depend on your experience and seniority, including:
• Contributing to our internal networks and special interest groups
• Mentoring to upskill peers and juniors

The ideal candidate should be / possess:
• Possess good communications skills to understand our customers' core business objectives and build end-to-end data centric solutions to address them
• Good critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
• Prior experience building compelling and usable data visualizations and analytics with commercial and/or open source BI tools
• Certification or hands-on experience in leading data analytics and visualisation products such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, MicroStrategy, SAS Visual Analytics
• Excel in Excel!

Nice to have:
• Experience with integrating dashboards and reports into applications and web forms
• Data pipeline and/or database development experience
• Prototyping and development skills in web front-end technologies such as JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React) especially on charting libraries (Highcharts, D3, Chart.js)

If you would like to be part of the winning team that does great work, apply today!

title: Sr. Business Insights Analyst
description:
• Bachelor’s degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills
• Proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data
• Proficiency in at least programming languages (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis
• Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation
• Creative and analytical thinking to generate interesting approaches to answering business questions
• Strong and effective written and oral communication to clearly convey data findings

Amazon Web Services, Inc. ("AWS") enables customers of all sizes to run their applications on Amazon’s industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced Business Insights Analyst. Amazon has a strong culture... of data-driven decision-making; requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Insights Analyst serves as the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands. As the successful candidate, you must be able to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

You will be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and possess creative problem-solving abilities. You will need to demonstrate subject matter expertise in querying and extracting large datasets and the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights; both verbally and in writing; in a clear and precise manner.

Main responsibilities:
• Lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products
• Conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models
• Continuously sharpen the skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging business intelligence tools
• Collaborate with the internal and global data engineering teams on the design, development and maintenance of data infrastructure including data models
• Collaborate with the internal and worldwide data science teams on the design, development and maintenance of statistical and/or artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models
• 10+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst
• Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
• Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases
• Experience working with Cloud Computing
• Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production
• AWS certified (AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, etc.)

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status

title: Information & Cyber Security Controls Testing - Project Manager, Senior Manager, Business Analyst
description:
About Job

CTC Undisclosed Job Location Singapore Experience 10 - 13 yrs

Description

About Standard Chartered

We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.

To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.

We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

The Trust, Data & Resilience Function

Significant transformation is underway within the Operations function to rapidly improve the Cyber, Data, Privacy and Automation control environment, along with digitization and innovation. A new function, TDR... (Trust, Data & Resilience), has been formed by pulling together Cyber Security Services, TPSR, ICS Operations, Data Management & Privacy, Automation and Resilience into one function to:

Grow trust with clients and regulators Best practice cyber security solutions; protection of data and privacy; improve resilience; reduce risk

Leverage analytics and insights to enable data monetisation Real time analytics; process automation; customer insights; eco-system partnerships; disruptive business practices

Be an enabler to journeys Steer the Bank using trust, innovation and data; supply real time information for actionable measures

To help grow trust with clients and regulators and maximize risk reduction, we are hiring these positions in Standard Chartered Singapore :

Excellent oral, written communication and presentation skills

Prior experience in Cyber Security Change Management projects and advantage.
Professional, highly adept at problem-solving, conflict resolution and negotiation.

Excellent written and spoken communication skills.

title: Market Data Business Analyst
description:
More About This Job

YOUR IMPACT

The Market Data Business Analyst team at Goldman Sachs are responsible for coordinating with internal business teams on the selection of products and ongoing management of the Firm's market data spend with third party vendors. The team provide guidance to internal users on data services appropriate for specific roles, coordinate expense management initiatives and provide data analytics to enable users to manage costs effectively.

The role provides the opportunity to directly contribute to managing the firms operating costs by building data analytics and automated workflow that help end-users to manage their market data subscriptions effectively. You will be responsible for developing data collection, modelling and visualization analytics that correlate usage with user inventories. The role will provide the opportunity to partner with divisional management and business unit leadership teams to implement expense management initiatives.

How Will You... Fulfill Your Potential

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
• You will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication
• Driving strategic initiatives and deliver key programs of work across Market Data and the broader division
• Your detailed knowledge of market data vendor products and an understanding of the Goldman Sachs business functions will enable you to formulate strategies to reduce operating expenses
• Building data analytics using popular storage and visualization technologies to empower market data users to manage their costs
• Interface with divisional leadership and front office users to implement expense management initiatives
• Continually evaluate the vendor landscape to identify new offerings that may increase value and efficiency for our employees who require access to market data
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• 2 years minimum experience in Market Data
• Python and SQL programming skills
• Experience of publishing and modeling data with distributed storage platforms such as Hadoop
• Experience with using visualization software (Tableau, Qlikview or equivalent)
• Japanese language
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• FISD's Financial Information Associate certification
• Proficient use of tier 1 market data vendor desktop software
• General understanding of the capital markets
• Experience of the MDSL MDM inventory system

About Goldman Sachs

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers .

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https:// www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

title: VP - Threat Content Developer - SIEM and Big Data Security Analytics - Group Information Security
description:
Job Responsibilities
Support in developing and implementing advance new use cases and threat model as per the Cyber Security landscape by following industry leading Security framework and enhance the existing use cases and threat model detection capabilities to detect sophisticated cyber-attacks.
Key Responsibilities:
• Drive and lead advanced security analytics initiative to drive value from Security Analytics.
• Review all existing Security contents in SIEM and Big Data Security Analytics
• Define new use cases and threat models and risk score threshold for use cases on SIEM and BIG Data platform
• Work with other stakeholders and develop custom use cases
• Ability to understand business problems and apply technology solutions, leveraging technology trends to deliver results by working closing with SOC and other key stakeholders
• Work with respective engineering team to articulate the clear requirements of attributes related for each data feeds those are required for creating use... cases and threat model
• Development, implementation and maintenance of use cases and also develop content around threat intel feeds
• Map all current and new use cases to MITRE ATT&CK framework and NIST methodology
• Develop detection strategies and security content for various threats
• Responsible for proactively developing common and known use cases.
• Development, optimization and management of use case framework
• Working with SOC and other key stakeholders in explaining all use cases and threat model for UAT, other testing and fine tuning.
• Performing Data Analytics and Threat hunting to get the context for use cases and threat model creation.
• Integrate and Monitor threat intel feed on the SIEM and Big Data platforms
• Monitor and track threat feeds ingestion and best utilization of threat feeds
• Use case (life cycle) management (research, development & maintenance)
• Conduct detailed analytical queries and investigations, identify areas that require specific attention, identify indicators of compromise (IOC) or events of interest (EOI) that need further investigation and develop use cases and rules to be developed into the SIEM platform
• Create and enhance internal processes and procedures how to the business requirements from other stakeholders.
• Act as a mentor and team lead to all First Level Security Analysts, support and supervise them, ensure knowledge transfer within the team
• Deliver qualified information about actual threats and indications, recommendations how the associated risk can be mitigated
• Develop, automate and maintain reports and dashboards
• Train and coach members of project groups to ensure effective knowledge management
• Engage in Purple Teaming exercises with our Red Team.

Job Requirements
Education
• ITC/Diploma/Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
• Demonstrated content development experience on any analytical platform or solution.
• Knowledge of risk assessment, security assessment, continuous monitoring, cyber kill chain/MITRE ATT&CK framework and/or regulatory (PCI, HIPAA, ISO27001 series)
• At least one of the leading certifications (CISSP, CISM, GSEC, , OSCP, GMON, CCSP).
• Certified SNYPR Content Developer (CSCD) would be an added advantage
• Had delivered quality tangible advance use cases and threat model on any SIEM or Big Data Analytical platform.
• Experience in any insider threat tools
Technical Skills
• Overall experience 8+ years of experience
• 4+ years of relevant experience in creating security use cases and threat contents
• Good understanding and experience of applying analytic methods and techniques to provide insight, identify risks and detect threats leveraging several data sets
• Experience in data enrichment and doing data analytics
• Experience with SIEM Threat Content Development
• Experience in developing and implementing use cases in with SIEM technologies and Security Analytics platform
• Had developed use cases using MITRE ATT&CK framework
• Strong understanding of Insider Threat system and Cyber threat system architecture along with understanding of user entity behavior analytics techniques and algorithm
• Strong knowledge in understanding Firewall, Proxy, Network, OS, Cloud, and other main-stream infrastructure logs.
• Familiar with Big Data Analytics, EDR, SIEM and other cyber technologies
• Basic knowledge in developing custom parsers (regex) required for data ingestion for any infrastructure or application based data feeds.
• Basic understanding of Big Data components which are required for data preparation.
• Working experience in Hadoop eco system would be plus.
• Experience of SQL and scripting (Python & Shell) would be a plus
• Understand of new threat landscape
Soft Skills
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Self-motivated and creative thinker
• Strong analytical and problem solving skill
• Passionate about cyber security and up-to-date with current threats.

title: Research Analyst, Gas/LNG at Wood Mackenzie
description:
Research Analyst, Gas/LNG at Wood Mackenzie

Job Description

Company Description Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors. Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists. Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge. We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a... sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join. Hear what our team has to say about working with us: https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/ We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. Itâ€™s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. Itâ€™s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. Itâ€™s the aim of our â€œreturnshipâ€ program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, itâ€™s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customersâ€™ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to WorkÂ® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. Weâ€™ve been recognized by Forbes as a Worldâ€™s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Veriskâ€™s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description Research Associate, Asia Pacific (APAC) Markets â€“ Gas & LNG We are looking for a Research Associate to join Wood Mackenzieâ€™s Asia Pacific Gas & LNG Markets Research team. Our team provides industry-leading fundamentals analysis and commercially relevant insights covering the Asia Pacific natural gas and LNG markets. This analytical role in the APAC gas markets team is pivotal to the success of the team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and delivering in-depth, high quality Gas Market analysis, including working with the Upstream team to forecast supply, supply-demand balancing and regional gas market analysis. This role will also be a key user of Wood Mackenzieâ€™s proprietary gas forecasting model and contribute significantly to the teamâ€™s long-term gas forecasts. The role holder will collaborate with the team to publish written reports and presentations for clients. About The Role Joining a team of gas and LNG analysts in the region, you will quickly contribute to our gas research. You will be the primary author for market reports and deeper fundamentals analysis for a specific focus region, e.g. Indonesia, Malaysia, China etc and will support the integrated markets update process for Asia Pacific and Global Commodities teams. You will work with other gas, power and upstream analysts on a variety of topics and create innovative reports to help visualize our data sets and interpret modelling results to communicate our views to clients. Along the way you will develop an understanding of your specific markets and their potential. To do this, you will be a key user of Wood Mackenzieâ€™s proprietary gas forecasting model. You will be a contributor to the update of our global gas outlook and support in developing our narrative for the APAC region. You will be comfortable articulating the supply and demand views and the broader short-term and long-term global gas outlook to clients and prospects. Through research trips, client interactions and industry events you will build your network to understand the key topics and challenges in the industry. You will address these in your contribution to our regular deliverables and through development of specific informs, the quarterly short-term outlook, insights and webinars. Qualifications About you and how you can excel in this role The Following Qualities Would Be Advantageous For Any Potential Candidate The role is ideal for someone who is passionate about the gas industry and wants to be a recognized expert internally and externally. You have an analytical mind and an eye for detail, but can still translate your findings into clear coherent messages for a variety of audiences. You will have experience working with statistical models including Excel and large data sets. Data visualization will be essential to deliver success in the role. A collaborative attitude and a desire to develop or expand gas market knowledge are also critical. You have good planning and organization skills with the ability to manage your own workload. You are pro-active and can deliver tangible improvements to processes and products. You have fostered strong working relationships, developed networks and have experience in influencing others. You are productive and driven in achieving your goals, but also support others in their development by sharing ideas. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. title: Agile Analyst/ Principal Agile Analyst
description:
Who we’re looking for

We’re looking for an Agile Analyst/ Principal Agile Analyst who has a strong domain working experience supporting Core Data for back office operations either in a financial or asset management industry. You need to have strong knowledge around Data Management Processes – Securities, Classifications, Analytics and Reference Data. Strong working knowledge of data vendors like Bloomberg, Refinitiv, MarkIT and interfaces for interactions. Exposure to back office operations, investment operations and portfolio performance/attribution is an advantage.

About Schroders

We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.

We have around 4,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients, and... society, prosper.

The base

This role will be based in Singapore at our CapitaGreen office.

The team

You will be part of the Capability aligned agile delivery team, responsible for contributing to all aspects of the analysis, design, development, building and testing of solutions within a sprint cadence. Each team member is aligned to a single Capability and, while the Agile Analyst’s core contribution will be leading the analysis and design aspects of software development, they also significantly contribute to development and testing activities.

What you’ll do
• Support Capability (Product) Owners and Epic Owners/Analysts to ensure that features and stories to be delivered by the Capability team are well defined and structured
• Lead analysis tasks which contribute to the delivery of working software required by the Capability [Product] Owner
• Contribute to the analysis, development, build and testing of working software required by the Capability [Product] Owner
• Accountable for ensuring user stories are delivered to the ‘working system’ definition of ‘done’ within an agreed sprint
• Accountable for ensuring committed PI Objectives and Sprint Objectives are met
• Contribute to agile planning, including sizing stories, parsing user stories into tasks etc.
• Working with colleagues from other agile teams and shared service teams to both communicate and accept dependencies
• Support the System Team in readiness for the System Demo
• Participate enthusiastically and effectively in Schroders Agile ceremonies
• Ensuring continued improvement through conducting regular retrospective reviews and executing high priority actions that emerge
• Committing to increasing their skills and experience in non-core specialisms (Dev, Test)
• Supporting other team members to improve their analysis skills and experiences
• Performing the role of Scrum Master for the agile team if required to do so
• Supporting the development of the wider Global Technology organisation through leadership of communities, guilds or key involvement in other non-core activities
• Conduct and lead business requirements gathering workshops

The knowledge, experience and qualifications you’ll need
• Domain Working experience in supporting back office, data operations in the Finance Asset Management industry i.e. asset managers, custodians, fund administrators, etc.
• Working knowledge of Data Management processes such as Pricing and Valuation, Instruments and Securities, Index and Benchmark data and not least, Client and Portfolio data.
• Working knowledge of financial instruments, setup and processing characteristics of products such as Equities, Fixed Income, Money Market, FX Forwards including NDFs; OTC Derivatives – Rates and Credits, CFD products.
• Exposure to working knowledge on Market Data, Reference Data, and understanding of organization’s Group Data Model (such as Operational Data, Investment Data) is preferred.
• Exposure to back office – trade processing, reconciliation, corporate actions, accounting and valuation and investment operations, portfolio performance and attribution is an added advantage.
• Working knowledge of systems such as BlackRock Aladdin, MarkIT EDM, Eagle PACE and Market Data Vendors like Refinitiv, Bloomberg, Factset, etc.
• Exposure to accounting platforms like Simcorp Dimension, Portia, Hi-portfolio is an advantage.
• Familiarity with Agile delivery methodologies, ideally SAFe
• Wide experience of business analysis across a number of different capabilities, systems or teams; number of different (positive) experiences is valued higher than length of experience
• High level of technical skill in use of business analysis techniques, methodologies and artefacts to support agile software development
• Knowledge and experience of using various tools – Alteryx, Tableau, MS Power Suite and SQL.
• Experience of working with global colleagues and stakeholders and sensitivity to cultural differences, time zones etc.
• Working experience in agile methodology e.g. sprint planning, backlog grooming, story writing
• Extensive knowledge and experience of contributing to the development of technology solutions, both in-house developed bespoke applications and commercially available off-the-shelf solutions
• Excellent understanding of the business context of the capabilities
• Excellent communications to stakeholders of various level, in a clear and concise manner as well to the Capability teams on work (features/stories)

What you’ll be like
• A degree graduate with at least 4 to 6 years’ of experience as a Business Analyst or Principal Agile Analyst
• Experience supporting Core Data in a back office operations environment within a financial or asset management industry
• Strong knowledge around data management processes i.e Securities, Classifications, Analytics and Reference Data.
• Working knowledge of data vendors like Bloomberg, Refinitiv, MarkIT and interfaces for interactions are preferred.
• Exposure to back office operations, investment operations and portfolio performance/attribution
• Enjoy working with global counterparts, colleagues and stakeholders and sensitive to cultural differences, time zones etc.
• Working experience in agile methodology e.g. sprint planning, backlog grooming, story writing
• Extensive knowledge and experience of contributing to the development of technology solutions, both in house developed bespoke applications and commercially available off the shelf solutions
• Excellent ability to communicate how the work [features and stories] delivered by the Capability teams contributes to Epics
• Passionate about mastering and innovating best practice in business analysis
• Inspiring and collaborative leader, model of agile leadership approach
• Continuous improvement mind-set, challenges the status quo and seeks self-improvement

Desirable technical skills
• Lean Agile credentials; Certified Safe Agilist (SA)
• Basic professional qualifications relating to the asset management industry (such as IMC) and business analysis (such as ISEB)
• CBAP / CFA or Agile practitioner

title: Quality Control Analyst
description: ICON plc, a leading Contract Research Organisation employing approximately 14,000 employees across 97 offices in 38 countries, seeks a highly motivated QC Analyst to join its Global Quality Team in the Singapore Laboratory.The successful candidate will join a professional and experienced team focused on making an impact globally and supporting ICON's mission - to help its clients accelerate the development of drugs and medical devices that save patient lives and improve their quality of life.The Role Based in the Singapore laboratory, the successful candidate will join the global QC team and will be responsible to work locally and globally within the quality monitoring system. The successful candidate will be responsible for the processing, maintenance, and improvement of global quality control data accumulated within the global quality and harmonization monitoring system to ensure the production of the highest quality data sets. The successful candidate needs to possess some... knowledge in areas such as method validation, and laboratory clinical laboratory systems and equipment.Due to the nature of this position it may be required for the employee to travel.Role responsibilities include: Sustaining the global quality control program for all ICON Laboratories including data entry, data management, data analysis, action plan development, and corrective action monitoring. Fluent knowledge of the global quality control system, skills to endure and successfully participate in internal, regulatory, and client audits with respect to the global quality control system. Support the Biorad Unity Quality Control System, and related activities. Prepare and present quality control summaries to Senior Management. Facilitate discussions, and contribution of advanced troubleshooting techniques that will provide opportunities to improve performance. Review and contribute cumulative knowledge to improve correlative performance between laboratories. Drive the laboratory correlation data analysis, and feedback process towards real time processing. Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements domestic, and internationally. Experience & Knowledge Requirements: Bachelor's Degree for Academy trained or ASCP Certified Technologists Masters or PhD. in Clinical Laboratory Science or related field for uncertified applicants Quality Certification / Six Sigma Certification preferred. 3 - 6 years of prior relevant clinical laboratory experience with some in a supervisory capacity. Academy trained or ASCP Certified Medical Technologists preferred Strong verbal and written communication skills. Knowledge of CAP regulatory requirements including proficient testing. Proven track record of contributing to quality, and process improvements. Ability to liaise, and develop a collaborative work environment with laboratory personnel including management. Strong understanding of statistical concepts with the ability to interpret the trends, and predict future performance. Ability to remain composed in stressful situations, performing effectively despite shifting priorities, work load, and external pressures. Accomplished action oriented self-starter actively seeking out improvements, and team development Mandarin-speaking ability is preferred. Benefits of Working in ICON: ICON enjoys a strong reputation for quality and is focused on staff development. title: Market Data Business Analyst
description:
More About This Job

YOUR IMPACT

The Market Data Business Analyst team at Goldman Sachs are responsible for coordinating with internal business teams on the selection of products and ongoing management of the Firm's market data spend with third party vendors. The team provide guidance to internal users on data services appropriate for specific roles, coordinate expense management initiatives and provide data analytics to enable users to manage costs effectively.

The role provides the opportunity to directly contribute to managing the firms operating costs by building data analytics and automated workflow that help end-users to manage their market data subscriptions effectively. You will be responsible for developing data collection, modelling and visualization analytics that correlate usage with user inventories. The role will provide the opportunity to partner with divisional management and business unit leadership teams to implement expense management initiatives.

How Will You... Fulfill Your Potential

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
• You will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication
• Driving strategic initiatives and deliver key programs of work across Market Data and the broader division
• Your detailed knowledge of market data vendor products and an understanding of the Goldman Sachs business functions will enable you to formulate strategies to reduce operating expenses
• Building data analytics using popular storage and visualization technologies to empower market data users to manage their costs
• Interface with divisional leadership and front office users to implement expense management initiatives
• Continually evaluate the vendor landscape to identify new offerings that may increase value and efficiency for our employees who require access to market data
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• 2 years minimum experience in Market Data
• Python and SQL programming skills
• Experience of publishing and modeling data with distributed storage platforms such as Hadoop
• Experience with using visualization software (Tableau, Qlikview or equivalent)
• Japanese language
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• FISD's Financial Information Associate certification
• Proficient use of tier 1 market data vendor desktop software
• General understanding of the capital markets
• Experience of the MDSL MDM inventory system

About Goldman Sachs

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers .

title: Associate/Analyst, Data Analyst - Monitoring & Reporting Team, Risk Management Group
description:
Business Function

Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure.
Job Purpose
• Support sound credit risk management and achieve optimal level of risk-reward balance for CBG portfolio
• Cultivate & maintain a consistent consumer credit culture in the Bank to ensure compliance with internal controls and regulatory standards
Key Accountabilities
• Perform portfolio analysis, monitor portfolio performance and proactively manage emerging risks due to macro-economic and regulatory changes.
• Ensure robustness in portfolio stress testing methodology and processes.
• Engage proactively with stakeholders from Business, Business... Analytics, Credit Approval, T&O (Cr-Ops), etc
• Ensure credit risk management are in line with business strategy, risk appetite, group and country policies/ standards and regulatory requirements.
• Support Credit Digitalisation projects.

Job Duties & Responsibilities
• Perform regular and ad-hoc risk reporting to consumer credit management/ line of business stakeholders and MIS preparation for regulatory reporting.
• Facilitate and perform regular and ad-hoc credit portfolio quality review.
• Identify opportunities/ gaps to improve data quality and existing reporting processes
• Apply analytics and data mining techniques using credit data and alternative data sources to monitor and analyse portfolio performance as well as dimension risk vs. reward balance on a regular basis.
• Validate and identify opportunities for optimizing acquisition and portfolio management through portfolio performance analysis.
• Analyse portfolio performance to assess risks and opportunities to maximize product profitability.
• Conduct portfolio stress testing to establish portfolio risk tolerance.
• Establish credit methodology to derive customer level income and max indicative secured credit limit using banking and credit bureau data.
• Provide UAT support for any data migration or MIS platform enhancement to ensure successful implementation.

Requirements
• Degree holder, preferably in risk management/ quantitative discipline with at least 3 years of relevant experience in financial sector
• Relevant working experience in statistics, data analytics and/ or project management
• Knowledge of SAS, R and/ or Python programming with strong command of Microsoft Office.
• Good understanding and knowledge of credit cycle management in a consumer credit environment preferred
• Team-player with good inter-personal, communication & writing skills
• Meticulous with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Seek to understand stakeholder's point of view and find win-win solution
• Motivated and self-driven

Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements. Risk Management

title: Technology Consulting Intern | Data & Analytics, Singapore (Ad hoc FY21)
description:
Job description

What if your career could have a lasting impact on you, and on the world?

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

The Data and Analytics team works collaboratively with our clients to manage engagements and lead teams of data analysis resources in all aspects of design and delivery of information solutions - including Data Quality and Governance, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, and Data... Management.

Data Analytics is integrated into all Consulting service offerings and assists clients to leverage data as an asset throughout its business processes. Your key responsibilities

· Help prepare reports or proposals that will be delivered to clients and other parties

What we look for

· You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
· You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
· You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
· Qualifications:
· Pursuing a degree in quantitative fields such as Computing, Engineering, Analytics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning, Operation Research, Information Management or related fields

What’s in it for you

· Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
· Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally.
· Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
· Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society – building a better working world, together.

What you can expect

· Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted via email for an interview.
· Shortlisted candidates will have to complete a test within 24 hours from date of receiving email confirmation of the interview appointment.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.

· Detailed resume
· Highest academic certification and transcripts

Perform assessment on all reporting requirements and develop long term strategy for various reporting solutions. Align multiple requirements to ensure data and development is optimised for maximum benefit Data Architecture Prepare architecture for data, prepare strategies and provide business object solutions as per requirements. Manage all data for transactional sources to enable effective reports/Dashboards. Plan and maintain development roadmap for dedicated AAAP architecture and data warehouse (DDMS) with the Group IM Power BI Reporting Delivery Deliver a development pipeline of automated Power BI Reporting & Dashboards prioritized by working with Senior Diamond Trading Management within scope of resources available. Manage full development cycle including Proof of Concept, Creation of Reports/dashboards, user testing and roll out PowerApps Delivery Deliver a development pipeline of automated PowerApps to support data and business process prioritized by working with Senior Diamond Trading Management within scope of resources available. Manage full development cycle including Proof of Concept, Creation of Power APPs, user testing and roll out Maintaining Tableau Reporting Delivery Maintain pipeline of automated Tableau Reporting & Dashboards prioritized by working with Senior Diamond Trading Management within scope of resources available. Manage migration of existing Tableau portfolio to a Microsoft Power BI platform including Proof of Concept, Creation of Reports/dashboards, user testing and roll out Ad Hoc / Support Manage the resolution of BI reporting issues by engaging with respective data, process, system owners and vendors to address issues impacting day to day operations of stakeholders. Work closely with the Trading analysts from operations, sales & commercial and finance to support their ad hoc analytical BI reporting requirements. People Management Line Management of report and data experts / in-business analytics developers. title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
• Leverage on data analytics knowledge & experience to facilitate FO to uncover the business pattern.
• Able to articulate clearly the business objective and the corresponding technical work to accomplish this.
• Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
• Expect incumbent to provide FO support on Tableau / UAT, as business is embarking on self-service journey for business intelligence platform.
• Managing users requests and user roles.
• Handling confidential data and information according to guidelines.
• Developing dashboards for analysis... using Tableau from multiple production systems.
• Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
• Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
• Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
• Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
• Evaluating changes and updates to source systems.
• Training end users on new reports and dashboards.
• Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent
• Strong background in quantitative thinking and statistical data analysis.
• 6-8 years of experience with SQL-based RDBMS
• General 2-3 years of experience with Hadoop & NoSQL & any open stack ETL & query Tools
• Good understanding of Data Analysis in relation to Business Process modelling
• Expert in SQL queries & PL/SQL scripting
• Experience in Data Modelling, Data Warehouse, ETL tools
• Business Intelligence and Self-Service Reporting tools
• Experience developing financial or accounting-related BI applications or dashboards
• Experience with other leading BI tools a plus (Tableau)
• Experience with other programming or scripting languages (e.g. Unix, SQL Script, JAVA)
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel
• Basic understanding of trading systems (Bloomberg, Reuters and FIX protocol)
• Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent tasks
• Excellent time management, scheduling, and organizational skills
• Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to work effectively under tight timelines and schedules
• Ability to work independently and as a contributing team member
• Ability to sense the importance or impact of issues and situations and take appropriate actions
• Must be flexible, innovative, and self-motivated
• Must have the flexibility to work extra hours to meet corporate and departmental goals
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements. Technology
